intro: Cunila lyrata, commonly known as the lyrated cunila, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along streambanks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
